data.title: Jazz cafés, books and brews: Here’s what’s new in RVA
data.meta_description: From new businesses and restaurants to road changes to new events, we’re looking to bring you updates on the latest and greatest happenings in the Richmond area.
data.text:
RICHMOND, Va. (WWBT) -12 On Your Side introduced a new monthly feature online earlier this year to highlight what’s new in your community.

From new businesses and restaurants to road changes to new events, we’re looking to update you on the latest and greatest happenings in the Richmond area. We’ll also look at significant events happening in your area!

Here is a look at what’s new in Central Virginia over the past month or so:

Restaurants

Mike’s Jazz Cafe is at 2526 Floyd Ave in Richmond. This Black-owned soul food restaurant and bakery offers cocktails and music-themed foods! Fans recommend the southern collard greens, Rock Steady rolls and the Gone Fishin’ salmon entree. They’re open Wednesday through Saturday from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. and then for Sunday jazz brunch from 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.

Cinnaholic is at 14225 Winterview Parkway in Midlothian. Here, you can create your own Gourmet Cinnamon roll and other homemade sweet treats with over 20 unique frosting flavors and various fresh and decadent toppings.

7 Brew Drive Thru Coffee opened at 11 Le Gordon Drive in Midlothian. The chain has iced and hot coffee, espresso, smoothies, energy drinks, milkshakes, and more! 7 Brew is known for adding six espresso shots in their coffee beverages by request, calling it a “Triple 7″ for anyone looking for that EXTRA pep in their step!

Mudhouse is at 418 W. Broad St. in Richmond. This specialty coffee shop offers award-winning coffee from small farms worldwide. The menu offers coffee, tea, baked goods and breakfast bagels. Customers can also purchase coffee to make at home.

Klines Dairy Bar is at 15589 Cosby Rd in Chesterfield. Made fresh daily, this ice cream bar serves up several delicious ice cream flavors. On the menu, you’ll find milkshakes, sundaes, flurries, frappes, and more. You can also enjoy food favorites such as BBQ sandwiches and hot dogs.

Businesses

Abi’s Books and Brews is at 1212 1/2 W Cary St in Richmond. This new bookstore is perfect for meetups or study dates, especially for VCU students. The bookstore sells used books, gelato, pastries and drinks.

Lotte Market is at 7801 W Broad St. This Asian market chain sells groceries and produce and Japanese, Korean and Chinese prepared foods. Fans of Lotte Market say they love the vast selection of hard-to-find items.

Baker Hydraulics is at 2115 N Hamilton Street in Richmond, VA. This 8,000-square-foot shop has the latest equipment for hydraulic cylinder repairs of all shapes and sizes.

Pop-up RVA in Chesterfield Town Center is a new indoor 9,000-square-foot vendor space open seven days a week and can accommodate up to 30 local businesses daily.

📸 Have you been to a new restaurant or business recently? Share a photo with us HERE.

On the Road

Whether it’s a new stoplight or a change in traffic pattern, On the Road highlights road projects that impact you and your commute.

Alternating lanes on Forest Hill Avenue between Westover Hills Boulevard and 41st Street will be closed Monday through Friday until December for a water main replacement project. Learn more here.

Expanding transportation routes across the James River are underway along Westover Hill Boulevard, Park Drive and Blanton Avenue in Richmond. The project includes street upgrades and better connections for the city’s biking and walking paths and is expected to wrap up this fall.

A year-long project to “calm traffic and ensure pedestrian safety“ along Forest Hill and Semmes avenues started this month. Crews will begin by replacing traffic signals, installing sidewalks, curb ramps and crosswalks and changing the traffic pattern on Forest Hill Avenue. Learn more here.

🚦 More traffic news >

Your photos!

We’d love to see your photos of new restaurants and businesses in your community! Share your photos below, and we may feature them in future “What’s new in RVA?” segments.

Events

While these may not be new events, we want to help you fill your calendar! Here’s a look at a few events happening in August.

RVA Unplugged at KavaClub, 1529 W. Main Street, is a monthly “unplugged” event—no technology allowed! A six-course vegan dinner curated by the chef of the month will be served along with a complimentary cup of kava and a selection of mocktails. There will also be live music for entertainment as attendees get to know each other face-to-face.

NASCAR race weekend at Richmond Raceway is back with the most competitive racing series of the summer. The NASCAR Craftsman Trucks Series will kick off on Saturday, Aug. 10, and the NASCAR Cup Series is on Sunday, Aug. 11.

Van Gogh Immersive Art Exhibit will take place at the Exhibition Hub Richmond Art Center for the entire month of August. The immersive event will feature some of Van Gogh’s most esteemed artwork in a 20,000-square-foot room filled with light, sound, and two-story projections.

Richmond Jazz and Music Festival at Maymont Park is returning Friday, Aug. 9, through Sunday, Aug. 11, with some of the most highly acclaimed R&B and rap artists of our time. The festivities will include food trucks, vendors and performances from artists such as Fantasia, Ludacris, Monica, Wyclef and more.

Through the Decades: DMV Classic Car Show - The Virginia Department of Motor Vehicles is celebrating its 100th anniversary with a car show showcasing the evolution of automotive history. The event will take place rain or shine on Saturday, Aug. 3, from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. at 2300 West Broad Street. Admission and parking are free.

RVA Duck Race & Festival of Inclusion at Browns Island is on Saturday, Aug. 3. The event is hosted by the Autism Society of Central Virginia and sponsored by 12 On Your Side to support critical programming and services for our local autism community.

804 Day at 17th Street Market in Shockoe Bottom on Friday, Aug. 2, is a day-long celebration featuring music performances across multiple stages, showcasing some of Richmond’s most diverse indie talents. Attendees can enjoy food, drinks, arts, culture and community spirit, making it a true celebration of all things Richmond.

Carytown Watermelon Festival is a popular event inviting the entire community to enjoy fresh watermelon, live music, food and more. The free event will be held on Sunday, Aug. 11, from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. in the heart of Carytown in Richmond.

3rd Annual Kicking it in the Community is at the Eastern Henrico Recreation Center at 1440 N Laburnum Avenue. This community kickball tournament is held on Saturday, Aug. 10, from 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. The event aims to foster unity in the city and surrounding areas in response to increasing violence in our communities. There will be a bounce house, petting zoo, arts and crafts, free haircuts, and a book bag/school supply giveaway for kids. Local businesses willing to provide job opportunities, health, fitness, etc, are also welcome to attend.

Richmond International Dragon Boat Festival is at Rocketts Landing. The event kicks off on Saturday, Aug. 3 and is Richmond’s biggest spectacle on water. It is led by 20 synchronized paddlers, a drummer, and a steersperson. They race 500 meters up the river in 40-foot canoes with decorative Chinese dragon heads and tails.

Richmond Water Lantern Festival is at Dorey Park and Recreation Center. The event will take place on Saturday, Aug. 17, bringing people together to celebrate light and community. The evening will feature delicious food trucks, lively music, activities, and thousands of lanterns illuminating the night with love, hope and happiness.

Summer R&B Wine Food & Music Festival at 10300 Courthouse Road in Chesterfield is on Saturday, Aug. 3. You can enjoy live music and entertainment, various wines, food and more. Guest must purchase a ticket to attend.

Richmond R&B Festival is at Kanawha Plaza, located at East Canal Street in Richmond, on Saturday, Aug. 17.

5th Annual Crabs, Beer & Spirits by the James is at Kanawha Plaza located at East Canal Street in Richmond on Saturday, Aug.24. At this 5th annual event. You can expect all-you-can-eat crab legs, live music, DJs, local vendors and more. Guest must purchase a ticket to attend.

📅 Check out more events >

Worth the Drive

Looking for a quick road trip? Check out these events that may be worth the drive to check out:

KIDZ BOP Live Tour 2024 - will kick off at the Veterans United Home Loans Amphitheater in Virginia Beach on Friday, Aug. 2. The KIDZ BOP Kids - Aleah, JJ, Shila, and Tyler - will perform today’s biggest hits live on stage, like “Dance The Night,” “Greedy,” “Vampire,” and more.

Free Labor Day Concert Series at Virginia Beach Oceanfront - A lineup of nationally recognized artists will head to Virginia Beach on Friday, August 30 – Sunday, September 1, for a free Labor Day concert series. The weekend also features a House Music Festival with multiple DJs performing on Saturday evening in the 17th Street Park. All shows start at 7:30 p.m.

Albemarle County Fair - Come and join the fun from Thursday, Aug. 1, through Saturday, Aug. 3, on the grounds at James Monroe’s Highland. This fun and festive “Old-Time Country Fair” will be a three-day agricultural celebration featuring baked goods, crafts, family entertainment, events, and livestock.

2024 African American Cultural Arts Festival- Come and celebrate black culture at 9950 Wellington Rd in Manassas, Virginia, on Saturday, Aug. 3, from 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Festivities include local vendors, live music, food, arts and crafts and a history gallery.

Meadows of Dan Folk Fair - Celebrate the traditions of the Blue Ridge Mountains at Meadows of Dan Village located at 2616 Jeb Stuart Hwy. Local merchants and organizations throughout Meadows of Dan will be sponsoring demonstrations of heritage, arts, and music. The event will occur on Aug. 17 from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Port to Port Beer Festival - Breweries from ports near and far are coming together to showcase their best brews on Aug. 17 from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. at the Port City Brewing Company at 3950 Wheeler Ave in Alexandria. Guests will receive a commemorative 5-ounce glass with their admission ticket and three tickets for 4oz pours.

Carroll County Agricultural Fair - Join the fun at 497 Farmers Market Drive in Hillsville, VA. The Carroll County Fair will kick off Aug. 21 to Aug. 25. Guests can enjoy unlimited carnival rides & fair-sponsored events for FREE with a paid gate fee.

Southwest Virginia Bee Festival - Embark on an unbelievable journey at the inaugural Bee Festival at Elmwood Park, located at 505 Williamson Road SE in Roanoke. The esteemed Roanoke Valley and Botetourt Beekeepers Associations cohost this unique event.

Neptune Festival 9th Annual Coastal Craft Beer Festival - 31st Street Park in Virginia Beach will be transformed into a craft beer lover’s haven, featuring local Virginia beers, ciders and seltzers, and national and regional craft beers. The event will kick off on Saturday, August 24, from 3 p.m. - 8 p.m.

Appaloosa Roots Music Festival - Appaloosa Roots Music Festival is an annual family-friendly event hosted at the Skyline Ranch Resort in Front Royal, Va. The festival features local, national, and international bands and musical workshops by top artists, with something fun for all ages. The event occurs Saturday, Aug. 31, through Sunday, Sept. 1, from 11 a.m. - 11 p.m.

Fun things to do

Got a day off but nothing to do? If you’re seeking a new adventure, here’s a list of new experiences in the area:

Taylor Farms Park at 200 Whiteside Road in Henrico. This new park offers amenities, including a fully accessible water park, zip lines, a rope climbing station, a 17,000-square-foot skate park and a BMX dirt skills course that the county hopes will eventually attract more sports tourism. A memorial also honors public safety workers and military service members.

Retro Boat Rentals RVA at 4708 Old Main Street in Richmond. Enjoy some time in a vintage boat near Rocketts Landing. No captain’s license or boating experience is required. Up to four guests per boat are welcome to bring food and drinks for a 1.5-hour-long ride on the James River. This new adventure is perfect for a unique date night, birthday celebration, or quick getaway on the water.

Safe Surf RVA at 9530 Osborne Turnpike in Richmond. Learn to surf at your own pace! Safe Surf RVA provides wake surfing lessons and outings for riding waves behind a motorboat. Wake surfing, unlike wakeboarding, is a lower-speed activity where you pull yourself into position, drop the rope and surf the wake hands-free. Instructors will be on-site to teach you everything you need to know, and no equipment is required.

RVA Hot Wheelz at 3107 Old Hillard Road in Richmond. Explore RVA in style with a Polaris Slingshot rental. Guests can book rentals for up to 24 hours, and if you have no experience driving a slingshot, each rental comes with step-by-step instructions on how to operate it safely. Drivers must be 21 or older, and insurance is required.

RVA Boat Excursion at 9530 Osborne Turnpike in Richmond. Experience the excitement of being on the water in a boat or a Jet Ski. RVA Boat Excursions offers up to 4-hour long boating experiences for up to 8 guests. Jet Ski Rentals are also available for up to 2 hours 7 days a week from 12 p.m. to 7 p.m.

Paddle Club RVA, at 4708 Old Main Street in Richmond. Enjoy the water with friends and/or family, doing an activity everyone can enjoy. Paddle Club RVA offers cruises on the James River, where passengers can enjoy the ambiance of nearby bike trails, recreational boaters, paddlers, and stunning views of the Richmond skyline. Each cruise can accommodate up to 20 passengers, making it the perfect adventure for a group.

NASCAR Racing Experience at Richmond International Raceway, 600 E Laburnum Avenue. If you have a need for speed, this is your chance to drive a NASCAR race car solo for up to 48 minutes. With no lead car to follow and no instructor, you’ll receive personalized instruction from a spotter over in-car radio. Drivers can also take advantage of brief pit stops every 8 minutes of track time before returning to the track to master driving at faster speeds.

Peak Experiences Explore the art of mountain climbing with experienced trainers at Peak Experiences. Climbers of all skill levels are invited to attempt over 125 top-rope routes, lead climbing, and bouldering. The climbing wall is regularly updated to provide new challenges and motivate climbers. There are two locations, one in Richmond on Overbrook Road and one in Midlothian on Polo Circle.

Richmond Fencing Club at 3411 1/2 Carlton Street in Richmond. Richmond Fencing Club has been in existence since the 1960s. Whether you’re a beginner or a competitive fencer, RFC offers class options to fit all skill levels.

Balloons Over Virginia at 9988 #8 Lickinghole Road in Ashland. Fly high year-round with Hot Air Balloon Flights or Tethered Hot Air Balloon Rides. This adventure is perfect for weddings, receptions, engagements, birthday parties, company retirements, memorial flights and other special events.

Richmond Urban Dance at 900 Catherine St in Richmond. Richmond Urban Dance is a dance company specializing in street-style dance and is open to individuals of all ages and skill levels.

Future happenings in RVA

Here’s a list of upcoming new businesses, restaurants, or events in Central Virginia.

Rise Southern Biscuits will be at 3510 W Cary Street, Suite 115, in the popular Carytown Exchange. Nothing is better than biscuits! This North Carolina-based restaurant has fluffy, buttermilk, cheddar, and blueberry biscuits made from scratch and filled with savory ingredients ranging from crispy bacon and country sausage to fried green tomatoes. This second Richmond location will open later this fall.

The Granite will be at 3088 Stony Point Rd, in the former Nuevo, Mexico, Stony Point Shopping Center in Bon Air. This bar-and-grill concept from Tazza Kitchen and Conejo will feature delicious Mexican eats and is set to open in early 2025.

Sweetgreen will be at 3502 W. Cary St. With over 200 locations nationwide, this will be the first location in Richmond to serve salads and bowls, aiming to build a community of people who believe in the power of real food. Currently, there’s no timeline as to when they will be open.

Foxtail Coffee Co. will be at 2240 Old Brick Road in the Short Pump shopping center. The cafe is set to open in the fall. The Florida-based coffee shop sells teas, baked goods, breakfast sandwiches and more.

Ford’s Garage will be at 11275 West Broad Street in Glen Allen. This car-inspired restaurant is the only establishment with licensing rights to Ford Motor Company’s iconic logos and insignia. The restaurant serves American classics such as burgers, brews, and cocktails.

How’s the Weather?

If you’re looking for the latest forecast and headlines in Richmond, download the 12 On Your Side and First Alert Weather App.

You can find the app in the Apple Store and on Google Play.

The 12 On Your Side First Alert Weather app features updated daily video forecasts, an hour-by-hour forecast, severe weather alerts, and much more.
